explanation:
Agent A’s characterization is correct. The expression-statement “(void) unif_buf_used;” (as described in the scenario) is executed at run-time, has no observable effect on program behaviour (assuming the variable is not volatile and the expression has no side-effects), and so meets MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2’s definition of dead code. Removing that statement would not change program behaviour in the normal case, therefore it is dead code and would violate Rule 2.2.

Caveats: If the expression actually performs a side-effect (for example the operand is volatile or evaluating it triggers unspecified/undefined behaviour that the program relies on), then it would not be dead code. Based on the scenario (the cast is present only to suppress an unused-variable warning), those caveats do not apply, so the report is correct. The empty probe log shown in the test code is unrelated to the validity of the claim about the (void)-cast being dead code.
